Belgia: 1590: Sep
t
:
Belgia 1590 8 Septe
m
To M
r
Bodly
S
r
. Hir
Ma
tie
being vearie desirous that at this time
uppon sum spetiall Course knowen to hir Ma
tie
, that some
Attem
Attempt
weare made uppon the Ennemie spetiallie in
Flanders
if yt might be, by such forces both of thes Cuntries, and of hir
owne people as might speedelie be drawen together for that
purpose, hath at this time written hir l
res
to
S
r
Frauncis Vere
verie ernestlie to deale w
th
the
Counte Maurice
to enterprise
this
s
vice, and by all the meanes he can to drawe the
States
Generall
or
Counsell of Estate
to yeld theareunto, w
ch
hir Ma
tie
hath a good hope will take effect: And she hath also willed
mee ernestlie by my privatt l
res
to recommend the same to yowe,
that yowe might upo yo
r
Creditt and Authorite either w
th
the
Counsell of estate or States generall,
exp
r
ssly in hir name
as yowe should see
Course to effect the same w
th
speed, w
ch
would be vearye
thankefullie accepted of hir Ma
tie
if she shall understand
that
they
shall reolve speedelie theareof, and so maie yowe lett
them understand. And so referring the same to yo
r
Carefull
and diligent solicitac
o
n, that it maie proceide as hir Ma
tie
ernestlie desireth yt should, I verie Hartelie Commend mee
to yowe./
From the
Cort at Windso
r
this viij
th
of
September.
1590
.
Yo
r
Very Loving frend./
William Burghley
I pray yow omitt no meanes
w
t
s
o
s publyk or p
r
vat to farther
this hir Ma
t
desyre, a thyng
both honorable and
fittable, but
of all other respect
, most
fittable for
e
F
r
K
y
g
estat
